module three.Triangle

function three.Triangle ( a, b, c )

  • description and source-code
    function Triangle( a, b, c ) {

		this.a = ( a !== undefined ) ? a : new Vector3();
		this.b = ( b !== undefined ) ? b : new Vector3();
		this.c = ( c !== undefined ) ? c : new Vector3();

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Triangle.barycoordFromPoint ( point, a, b, c, optionalTarget )

  • description and source-code
    function barycoordFromPoint( point, a, b, c, optionalTarget ) {

			v0.subVectors( c, a );
			v1.subVectors( b, a );
			v2.subVectors( point, a );

			var dot00 = v0.dot( v0 );
			var dot01 = v0.dot( v1 );
			var dot02 = v0.dot( v2 );
			var dot11 = v1.dot( v1 );
			var dot12 = v1.dot( v2 );

			var denom = ( dot00 * dot11 - dot01 * dot01 );

			var result = optionalTarget || new Vector3();

			// collinear or singular triangle
			if ( denom === 0 ) {

				// arbitrary location outside of triangle?
				// not sure if this is the best idea, maybe should be returning undefined
				return result.set( - 2, - 1, - 1 );

			}

			var invDenom = 1 / denom;
			var u = ( dot11 * dot02 - dot01 * dot12 ) * invDenom;
			var v = ( dot00 * dot12 - dot01 * dot02 ) * invDenom;

			// barycentric coordinates must always sum to 1
			return result.set( 1 - u - v, v, u );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Triangle.containsPoint ( point, a, b, c )

  • description and source-code
    function containsPoint( point, a, b, c ) {

			var result = Triangle.barycoordFromPoint( point, a, b, c, v1 );

			return ( result.x >= 0 ) && ( result.y >= 0 ) && ( ( result.x + result.y ) <= 1 );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Triangle.normal ( a, b, c, optionalTarget )

  • description and source-code
    function normal( a, b, c, optionalTarget ) {

			var result = optionalTarget || new Vector3();

			result.subVectors( c, b );
			v0.subVectors( a, b );
			result.cross( v0 );

			var resultLengthSq = result.lengthSq();
			if ( resultLengthSq > 0 ) {

				return result.multiplyScalar( 1 / Math.sqrt( resultLengthSq ) );

			}

			return result.set( 0, 0, 0 );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.Triangle.prototype

function three.Triangle.prototype.area ()

  • description and source-code
    function area() {

				v0.subVectors( this.c, this.b );
				v1.subVectors( this.a, this.b );

				return v0.cross( v1 ).length() * 0.5;

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Triangle.prototype.barycoordFromPoint ( point, optionalTarget )

  • description and source-code
    barycoordFromPoint = function ( point, optionalTarget ) {

			return Triangle.barycoordFromPoint( point, this.a, this.b, this.c, optionalTarget );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Triangle.prototype.clone ()

  • description and source-code
    clone = function () {

			return new this.constructor().copy( this );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Triangle.prototype.closestPointToPoint ( point, optionalTarget )

  • description and source-code
    function closestPointToPoint( point, optionalTarget ) {

				if ( plane === undefined ) {

					plane = new Plane();
					edgeList = [ new Line3(), new Line3(), new Line3() ];
					projectedPoint = new Vector3();
					closestPoint = new Vector3();

				}

				var result = optionalTarget || new Vector3();
				var minDistance = Infinity;

				// project the point onto the plane of the triangle

				plane.setFromCoplanarPoints( this.a, this.b, this.c );
				plane.projectPoint( point, projectedPoint );

				// check if the projection lies within the triangle

				if( this.containsPoint( projectedPoint ) === true ) {

					// if so, this is the closest point

					result.copy( projectedPoint );

				} else {

					// if not, the point falls outside the triangle. the result is the closest point to the triangle's edges or vertices

					edgeList[ 0 ].set( this.a, this.b );
					edgeList[ 1 ].set( this.b, this.c );
					edgeList[ 2 ].set( this.c, this.a );

					for( var i = 0; i < edgeList.length; i ++ ) {

						edgeList[ i ].closestPointToPoint( projectedPoint, true, closestPoint );

						var distance = projectedPoint.distanceToSquared( closestPoint );

						if( distance < minDistance ) {

							minDistance = distance;

							result.copy( closestPoint );

						}

					}

				}

				return result;

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

		this.a = ( a !== undefined ) ? a : new Vector3();
		this.b = ( b !== undefined ) ? b : new Vector3();
		this.c = ( c !== undefined ) ? c : new Vector3();

	}

			this.b.copy( triangle.b );
			this.c.copy( triangle.c );

			return this;

		}

			return triangle.a.equals( this.a ) && triangle.b.equals( this.b ) && triangle.c.equals( this.c );

		}

    midpoint = function ( optionalTarget ) {

			var result = optionalTarget || new Vector3();
			return result.addVectors( this.a, this.b ).add( this.c ).multiplyScalar( 1 / 3 );

		}

module three.TubeBufferGeometry

function three.TubeBufferGeometry ( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed )

  • description and source-code
    function TubeBufferGeometry( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed ) {

		BufferGeometry.call( this );

		this.type = 'TubeBufferGeometry';

		this.parameters = {
			path: path,
			tubularSegments: tubularSegments,
			radius: radius,
			radialSegments: radialSegments,
			closed: closed
		};

		tubularSegments = tubularSegments || 64;
		radius = radius || 1;
		radialSegments = radialSegments || 8;
		closed = closed || false;

		var frames = path.computeFrenetFrames( tubularSegments, closed );

		// expose internals

		this.tangents = frames.tangents;
		this.normals = frames.normals;
		this.binormals = frames.binormals;

		// helper variables

		var vertex = new Vector3();
		var normal = new Vector3();
		var uv = new Vector2();

		var i, j;

		// buffer

		var vertices = [];
		var normals = [];
		var uvs = [];
		var indices = [];

		// create buffer data

		generateBufferData();

		// build geometry

		this.setIndex( indices );
		this.addAttribute( 'position', new Float32BufferAttribute( vertices, 3 ) );
		this.addAttribute( 'normal', new Float32BufferAttribute( normals, 3 ) );
		this.addAttribute( 'uv', new Float32BufferAttribute( uvs, 2 ) );

		// functions

		function generateBufferData() {

			for ( i = 0; i < tubularSegments; i ++ ) {

				generateSegment( i );

			}

			// if the geometry is not closed, generate the last row of vertices and normals
			// at the regular position on the given path
			//
			// if the geometry is closed, duplicate the first row of vertices and normals (uvs will differ)

			generateSegment( ( closed === false ) ? tubularSegments : 0 );

			// uvs are generated in a separate function.
			// this makes it easy compute correct values for closed geometries

			generateUVs();

			// finally create faces

			generateIndices();

		}

		function generateSegment( i ) {

			// we use getPointAt to sample evenly distributed points from the given path

			var P = path.getPointAt( i / tubularSegments );

			// retrieve corresponding normal and binormal

			var N = frames.normals[ i ];
			var B = frames.binormals[ i ];

			// generate normals and vertices for the current segment

			for ( j = 0; j <= radialSegments; j ++ ) {

				var v = j / radialSegments * Math.PI * 2;

				var sin =   Math.sin( v );
				var cos = - Math.cos( v );

				// normal

				normal.x = ( cos * N.x + sin * B.x );
				normal.y = ( cos * N.y + sin * B.y );
				normal.z = ( cos * N.z + sin * B.z );
				normal.normalize();

				normals.push( normal.x, normal.y, normal.z );

				// vertex

				vertex.x = P.x + radius * normal.x;
				vertex.y = P.y + radius * normal.y;
				vertex.z = P.z + radius * normal.z;

				vertices.push( vertex.x, vertex.y, vertex.z );

			}

		}

		function generateIndices() {

			for ( j = 1; j <= tubularSegments; j ++ ) {

				for ( i = 1; i <= radialSegments; i ++ ) {

					var a = ( radialSegments + 1 ) * ( j - 1 ) + ( i - 1 );
					var b = ( radialSegments + 1 ) * j + ( i - 1 );
					var c = ( radialSegments + 1 ) * j + i;
					var d = ( radialSegments + 1 ) * ( j - 1 ) + i;

					// faces

					indices.push( a, b, d );
					indices.push( b, c, d );

				}

			}

		}

		function generateUVs() {

			for ( i = 0; i <= tubularSegments; i ++ ) {

				for ( j = 0; j <= radialSegments; j ++ ) {

					uv.x = i / tubularSegments;
					uv.y = j / radialSegments;

					uvs.push( uv.x, uv.y );

				}

			}

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.TubeBufferGeometry.prototype

function three.TubeBufferGeometry.prototype.constructor ( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed )

  • description and source-code
    function TubeBufferGeometry( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed ) {

		BufferGeometry.call( this );

		this.type = 'TubeBufferGeometry';

		this.parameters = {
			path: path,
			tubularSegments: tubularSegments,
			radius: radius,
			radialSegments: radialSegments,
			closed: closed
		};

		tubularSegments = tubularSegments || 64;
		radius = radius || 1;
		radialSegments = radialSegments || 8;
		closed = closed || false;

		var frames = path.computeFrenetFrames( tubularSegments, closed );

		// expose internals

		this.tangents = frames.tangents;
		this.normals = frames.normals;
		this.binormals = frames.binormals;

		// helper variables

		var vertex = new Vector3();
		var normal = new Vector3();
		var uv = new Vector2();

		var i, j;

		// buffer

		var vertices = [];
		var normals = [];
		var uvs = [];
		var indices = [];

		// create buffer data

		generateBufferData();

		// build geometry

		this.setIndex( indices );
		this.addAttribute( 'position', new Float32BufferAttribute( vertices, 3 ) );
		this.addAttribute( 'normal', new Float32BufferAttribute( normals, 3 ) );
		this.addAttribute( 'uv', new Float32BufferAttribute( uvs, 2 ) );

		// functions

		function generateBufferData() {

			for ( i = 0; i < tubularSegments; i ++ ) {

				generateSegment( i );

			}

			// if the geometry is not closed, generate the last row of vertices and normals
			// at the regular position on the given path
			//
			// if the geometry is closed, duplicate the first row of vertices and normals (uvs will differ)

			generateSegment( ( closed === false ) ? tubularSegments : 0 );

			// uvs are generated in a separate function.
			// this makes it easy compute correct values for closed geometries

			generateUVs();

			// finally create faces

			generateIndices();

		}

		function generateSegment( i ) {

			// we use getPointAt to sample evenly distributed points from the given path

			var P = path.getPointAt( i / tubularSegments );

			// retrieve corresponding normal and binormal

			var N = frames.normals[ i ];
			var B = frames.binormals[ i ];

			// generate normals and vertices for the current segment

			for ( j = 0; j <= radialSegments; j ++ ) {

				var v = j / radialSegments * Math.PI * 2;

				var sin =   Math.sin( v );
				var cos = - Math.cos( v );

				// normal

				normal.x = ( cos * N.x + sin * B.x );
				normal.y = ( cos * N.y + sin * B.y );
				normal.z = ( cos * N.z + sin * B.z );
				normal.normalize();

				normals.push( normal.x, normal.y, normal.z );

				// vertex

				vertex.x = P.x + radius * normal.x;
				vertex.y = P.y + radius * normal.y;
				vertex.z = P.z + radius * normal.z;

				vertices.push( vertex.x, vertex.y, vertex.z );

			}

		}

		function generateIndices() {

			for ( j = 1; j <= tubularSegments; j ++ ) {

				for ( i = 1; i <= radialSegments; i ++ ) {

					var a = ( radialSegments + 1 ) * ( j - 1 ) + ( i - 1 );
					var b = ( radialSegments + 1 ) * j + ( i - 1 );
					var c = ( radialSegments + 1 ) * j + i;
					var d = ( radialSegments + 1 ) * ( j - 1 ) + i;

					// faces

					indices.push( a, b, d );
					indices.push( b, c, d );

				}

			}

		}

		function generateUVs() {

			for ( i = 0; i <= tubularSegments; i ++ ) {

				for ( j = 0; j <= radialSegments; j ++ ) {

					uv.x = i / tubularSegments;
					uv.y = j / radialSegments;

					uvs.push( uv.x, uv.y );

				}

			}

		}

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.TubeGeometry

function three.TubeGeometry ( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed, taper )

  • description and source-code
    function TubeGeometry( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed, taper ) {

		Geometry.call( this );

		this.type = 'TubeGeometry';

		this.parameters = {
			path: path,
			tubularSegments: tubularSegments,
			radius: radius,
			radialSegments: radialSegments,
			closed: closed
		};

		if ( taper !== undefined ) console.warn( 'THREE.TubeGeometry: taper has been removed.' );

		var bufferGeometry = new TubeBufferGeometry( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed );

		// expose internals

		this.tangents = bufferGeometry.tangents;
		this.normals = bufferGeometry.normals;
		this.binormals = bufferGeometry.binormals;

		// create geometry

		this.fromBufferGeometry( bufferGeometry );
		this.mergeVertices();

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.TubeGeometry.prototype

function three.TubeGeometry.prototype.constructor ( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed, taper )

  • description and source-code
    function TubeGeometry( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed, taper ) {

		Geometry.call( this );

		this.type = 'TubeGeometry';

		this.parameters = {
			path: path,
			tubularSegments: tubularSegments,
			radius: radius,
			radialSegments: radialSegments,
			closed: closed
		};

		if ( taper !== undefined ) console.warn( 'THREE.TubeGeometry: taper has been removed.' );

		var bufferGeometry = new TubeBufferGeometry( path, tubularSegments, radius, radialSegments, closed );

		// expose internals

		this.tangents = bufferGeometry.tangents;
		this.normals = bufferGeometry.normals;
		this.binormals = bufferGeometry.binormals;

		// create geometry

		this.fromBufferGeometry( bufferGeometry );
		this.mergeVertices();

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.Uint16BufferAttribute

function three.Uint16BufferAttribute ( array, itemSize )

    function Uint16BufferAttribute( array, itemSize ) {

		BufferAttribute.call( this, new Uint16Array( array ), itemSize );

	}
  • example usage

module three.Uniform

function three.Uniform ( value )

  • description and source-code
    function Uniform( value ) {

		if ( typeof value === 'string' ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Uniform: Type parameter is no longer needed.' );
			value = arguments[ 1 ];

		}

		this.value = value;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.Uniform.prototype

function three.Uniform.prototype.clone ()

  • description and source-code
    clone = function () {

		return new Uniform( this.value.clone === undefined ? this.value : this.value.clone() );

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.UniformsUtils

function three.UniformsUtils.clone ( uniforms_src )

  • description and source-code
    clone = function ( uniforms_src ) {

			var uniforms_dst = {};

			for ( var u in uniforms_src ) {

				uniforms_dst[ u ] = {};

				for ( var p in uniforms_src[ u ] ) {

					var parameter_src = uniforms_src[ u ][ p ];

					if ( parameter_src && ( parameter_src.isColor ||
						parameter_src.isMatrix3 || parameter_src.isMatrix4 ||
						parameter_src.isVector2 || parameter_src.isVector3 || parameter_src.isVector4 ||
						parameter_src.isTexture ) ) {

						uniforms_dst[ u ][ p ] = parameter_src.clone();

					} else if ( Array.isArray( parameter_src ) ) {

						uniforms_dst[ u ][ p ] = parameter_src.slice();

					} else {

						uniforms_dst[ u ][ p ] = parameter_src;

					}

				}

			}

			return uniforms_dst;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.UniformsUtils.merge ( uniforms )

  • description and source-code
    merge = function ( uniforms ) {

			var merged = {};

			for ( var u = 0; u < uniforms.length; u ++ ) {

				var tmp = this.clone( uniforms[ u ] );

				for ( var p in tmp ) {

					merged[ p ] = tmp[ p ];

				}

			}

			return merged;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.Vector2

function three.Vector2 ( x, y )

  • description and source-code
    function Vector2( x, y ) {

		this.x = x || 0;
		this.y = y || 0;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.Vector2.prototype

function three.Vector2.prototype.add ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    add = function ( v, w ) {

			if ( w !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector2: .add() now only accepts one argument. Use .addVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
				return this.addVectors( v, w );

			}

			this.x += v.x;
			this.y += v.y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    ...
	camera = new THREE.PerspectiveCamera( 75, window.innerWidth / window.innerHeight, 1, 10000 );
	camera.position.z = 1000;

	geometry = new THREE.BoxGeometry( 200, 200, 200 );
	material = new THREE.MeshBasicMaterial( { color: 0xff0000, wireframe: true } );

	mesh = new THREE.Mesh( geometry, material );
	scene.add( mesh );

	renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer();
	renderer.setSize( window.innerWidth, window.innerHeight );

	document.body.appendChild( renderer.domElement );

}
...

function three.Vector2.prototype.addScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    addScalar = function ( s ) {

			this.x += s;
			this.y += s;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.addScaledVector ( v, s )

  • description and source-code
    addScaledVector = function ( v, s ) {

			this.x += v.x * s;
			this.y += v.y * s;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.addVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    addVectors = function ( a, b ) {

			this.x = a.x + b.x;
			this.y = a.y + b.y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.angle ()

  • description and source-code
    angle = function () {

			// computes the angle in radians with respect to the positive x-axis

			var angle = Math.atan2( this.y, this.x );

			if ( angle < 0 ) angle += 2 * Math.PI;

			return angle;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.ceil ()

  • description and source-code
    ceil = function () {

			this.x = Math.ceil( this.x );
			this.y = Math.ceil( this.y );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.clamp ( min, max )

  • description and source-code
    clamp = function ( min, max ) {

			// This function assumes min < max, if this assumption isn't true it will not operate correctly

			this.x = Math.max( min.x, Math.min( max.x, this.x ) );
			this.y = Math.max( min.y, Math.min( max.y, this.y ) );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.clampLength ( min, max )

  • description and source-code
    clampLength = function ( min, max ) {

			var length = this.length();

			return this.multiplyScalar( Math.max( min, Math.min( max, length ) ) / length );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.clampScalar ( minVal, maxVal )

  • description and source-code
    function clampScalar( minVal, maxVal ) {

				if ( min === undefined ) {

					min = new Vector2();
					max = new Vector2();

				}

				min.set( minVal, minVal );
				max.set( maxVal, maxVal );

				return this.clamp( min, max );

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.clone ()

  • description and source-code
    clone = function () {

			return new this.constructor( this.x, this.y );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code

		this.x = x || 0;
		this.y = y || 0;

	}

			this.x = v.x;
			this.y = v.y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage

function three.Vector2.prototype.distanceTo ( v )

  • description and source-code
    distanceTo = function ( v ) {

			return Math.sqrt( this.distanceToSquared( v ) );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.distanceToManhattan ( v )

  • description and source-code
    distanceToManhattan = function ( v ) {

			return Math.abs( this.x - v.x ) + Math.abs( this.y - v.y );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.distanceToSquared ( v )

  • description and source-code
    distanceToSquared = function ( v ) {

			var dx = this.x - v.x, dy = this.y - v.y;
			return dx * dx + dy * dy;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.divide ( v )

  • description and source-code
    divide = function ( v ) {

			this.x /= v.x;
			this.y /= v.y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.divideScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    divideScalar = function ( scalar ) {

			return this.multiplyScalar( 1 / scalar );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.dot ( v )

  • description and source-code
    dot = function ( v ) {

			return this.x * v.x + this.y * v.y;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.equals ( v )

  • description and source-code
    equals = function ( v ) {

			return ( ( v.x === this.x ) && ( v.y === this.y ) );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    floor = function () {

			this.x = Math.floor( this.x );
			this.y = Math.floor( this.y );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage

function three.Vector2.prototype.fromArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromArray = function ( array, offset ) {

			if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

			this.x = array[ offset ];
			this.y = array[ offset + 1 ];

			return this;

		}
  • example usage

function three.Vector2.prototype.fromAttribute ( attribute, index, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromAttribute = function ( attribute, index, offset ) {

			console.error( 'THREE.Vector2: .fromAttribute() has been renamed to .fromBufferAttribute().' );
			return this.fromBufferAttribute( attribute, index, offset );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.fromBufferAttribute ( attribute, index, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromBufferAttribute = function ( attribute, index, offset ) {

			if ( offset !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector2: offset has been removed from .fromBufferAttribute().' );

			}

			this.x = attribute.getX( index );
			this.y = attribute.getY( index );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.getComponent ( index )

  • description and source-code
    getComponent = function ( index ) {

			switch ( index ) {

				case 0: return this.x;
				case 1: return this.y;
				default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

			}

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.length ()

  • description and source-code
    length = function () {

			return Math.sqrt( this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.lengthManhattan ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthManhattan = function () {

			return Math.abs( this.x ) + Math.abs( this.y );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.lengthSq ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthSq = function () {

			return this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.lerp ( v, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerp = function ( v, alpha ) {

			this.x += ( v.x - this.x ) * alpha;
			this.y += ( v.y - this.y ) * alpha;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.lerpVectors ( v1, v2, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerpVectors = function ( v1, v2, alpha ) {

			return this.subVectors( v2, v1 ).multiplyScalar( alpha ).add( v1 );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.max ( v )

  • description and source-code
    max = function ( v ) {

			this.x = Math.max( this.x, v.x );
			this.y = Math.max( this.y, v.y );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.min ( v )

  • description and source-code
    min = function ( v ) {

			this.x = Math.min( this.x, v.x );
			this.y = Math.min( this.y, v.y );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.multiply ( v )

  • description and source-code
    multiply = function ( v ) {

			this.x *= v.x;
			this.y *= v.y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.multiplyScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    multiplyScalar = function ( scalar ) {

			if ( isFinite( scalar ) ) {

				this.x *= scalar;
				this.y *= scalar;

			} else {

				this.x = 0;
				this.y = 0;

			}

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.negate ()

  • description and source-code
    negate = function () {

			this.x = - this.x;
			this.y = - this.y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.normalize ()

  • description and source-code
    normalize = function () {

			return this.divideScalar( this.length() );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.rotateAround ( center, angle )

  • description and source-code
    rotateAround = function ( center, angle ) {

			var c = Math.cos( angle ), s = Math.sin( angle );

			var x = this.x - center.x;
			var y = this.y - center.y;

			this.x = x * c - y * s + center.x;
			this.y = x * s + y * c + center.y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.round ()

  • description and source-code
    round = function () {

			this.x = Math.round( this.x );
			this.y = Math.round( this.y );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.roundToZero ()

  • description and source-code
    roundToZero = function () {

			this.x = ( this.x < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.x ) : Math.floor( this.x );
			this.y = ( this.y < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.y ) : Math.floor( this.y );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.set ( x, y )

  • description and source-code
    set = function ( x, y ) {

			this.x = x;
			this.y = y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.setComponent ( index, value )

  • description and source-code
    setComponent = function ( index, value ) {

			switch ( index ) {

				case 0: this.x = value; break;
				case 1: this.y = value; break;
				default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

			}

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.setLength ( length )

  • description and source-code
    setLength = function ( length ) {

			return this.multiplyScalar( length / this.length() );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

    setScalar = function ( scalar ) {

			this.x = scalar;
			this.y = scalar;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage

			return this;

		}

			this.y = y;

			return this;

  • example usage

function three.Vector2.prototype.sub ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    sub = function ( v, w ) {

			if ( w !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector2: .sub() now only accepts one argument. Use .subVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
				return this.subVectors( v, w );

			}

			this.x -= v.x;
			this.y -= v.y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.subScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    subScalar = function ( s ) {

			this.x -= s;
			this.y -= s;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.subVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    subVectors = function ( a, b ) {

			this.x = a.x - b.x;
			this.y = a.y - b.y;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector2.prototype.toArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    toArray = function ( array, offset ) {

			if ( array === undefined ) array = [];
			if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

			array[ offset ] = this.x;
			array[ offset + 1 ] = this.y;

			return array;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.Vector3

function three.Vector3 ( x, y, z )

  • description and source-code
    function Vector3( x, y, z ) {

		this.x = x || 0;
		this.y = y || 0;
		this.z = z || 0;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.Vector3.prototype

function three.Vector3.prototype.add ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    add = function ( v, w ) {

			if ( w !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .add() now only accepts one argument. Use .addVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
				return this.addVectors( v, w );

			}

			this.x += v.x;
			this.y += v.y;
			this.z += v.z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    ...
	camera = new THREE.PerspectiveCamera( 75, window.innerWidth / window.innerHeight, 1, 10000 );
	camera.position.z = 1000;

	geometry = new THREE.BoxGeometry( 200, 200, 200 );
	material = new THREE.MeshBasicMaterial( { color: 0xff0000, wireframe: true } );

	mesh = new THREE.Mesh( geometry, material );
	scene.add( mesh );

	renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer();
	renderer.setSize( window.innerWidth, window.innerHeight );

	document.body.appendChild( renderer.domElement );

}
...

function three.Vector3.prototype.addScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    addScalar = function ( s ) {

			this.x += s;
			this.y += s;
			this.z += s;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.addScaledVector ( v, s )

  • description and source-code
    addScaledVector = function ( v, s ) {

			this.x += v.x * s;
			this.y += v.y * s;
			this.z += v.z * s;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.addVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    addVectors = function ( a, b ) {

			this.x = a.x + b.x;
			this.y = a.y + b.y;
			this.z = a.z + b.z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.angleTo ( v )

  • description and source-code
    angleTo = function ( v ) {

			var theta = this.dot( v ) / ( Math.sqrt( this.lengthSq() * v.lengthSq() ) );

			// clamp, to handle numerical problems

			return Math.acos( _Math.clamp( theta, - 1, 1 ) );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.applyAxisAngle ( axis, angle )

  • description and source-code
    function applyAxisAngle( axis, angle ) {

				if ( quaternion === undefined ) quaternion = new Quaternion();

				return this.applyQuaternion( quaternion.setFromAxisAngle( axis, angle ) );

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.applyEuler ( euler )

  • description and source-code
    function applyEuler( euler ) {

				if ( (euler && euler.isEuler) === false ) {

					console.error( 'THREE.Vector3: .applyEuler() now expects an Euler rotation rather than a Vector3 and order.' );

				}

				if ( quaternion === undefined ) quaternion = new Quaternion();

				return this.applyQuaternion( quaternion.setFromEuler( euler ) );

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.applyMatrix3 ( m )

  • description and source-code
    applyMatrix3 = function ( m ) {

			var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;
			var e = m.elements;

			this.x = e[ 0 ] * x + e[ 3 ] * y + e[ 6 ] * z;
			this.y = e[ 1 ] * x + e[ 4 ] * y + e[ 7 ] * z;
			this.z = e[ 2 ] * x + e[ 5 ] * y + e[ 8 ] * z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.applyMatrix4 ( m )

  • description and source-code
    applyMatrix4 = function ( m ) {

			var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;
			var e = m.elements;

			this.x = e[ 0 ] * x + e[ 4 ] * y + e[ 8 ]  * z + e[ 12 ];
			this.y = e[ 1 ] * x + e[ 5 ] * y + e[ 9 ]  * z + e[ 13 ];
			this.z = e[ 2 ] * x + e[ 6 ] * y + e[ 10 ] * z + e[ 14 ];
			var w =  e[ 3 ] * x + e[ 7 ] * y + e[ 11 ] * z + e[ 15 ];

			return this.divideScalar( w );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.applyProjection ( m )

  • description and source-code
    applyProjection = function ( m ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .applyProjection() has been removed. Use .applyMatrix4( m ) instead.' );
			return this.applyMatrix4( m );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.applyQuaternion ( q )

  • description and source-code
    applyQuaternion = function ( q ) {

			var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;
			var qx = q.x, qy = q.y, qz = q.z, qw = q.w;

			// calculate quat * vector

			var ix =  qw * x + qy * z - qz * y;
			var iy =  qw * y + qz * x - qx * z;
			var iz =  qw * z + qx * y - qy * x;
			var iw = - qx * x - qy * y - qz * z;

			// calculate result * inverse quat

			this.x = ix * qw + iw * - qx + iy * - qz - iz * - qy;
			this.y = iy * qw + iw * - qy + iz * - qx - ix * - qz;
			this.z = iz * qw + iw * - qz + ix * - qy - iy * - qx;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.ceil ()

  • description and source-code
    ceil = function () {

			this.x = Math.ceil( this.x );
			this.y = Math.ceil( this.y );
			this.z = Math.ceil( this.z );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.clamp ( min, max )

  • description and source-code
    clamp = function ( min, max ) {

			// This function assumes min < max, if this assumption isn't true it will not operate correctly

			this.x = Math.max( min.x, Math.min( max.x, this.x ) );
			this.y = Math.max( min.y, Math.min( max.y, this.y ) );
			this.z = Math.max( min.z, Math.min( max.z, this.z ) );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.clampLength ( min, max )

  • description and source-code
    clampLength = function ( min, max ) {

			var length = this.length();

			return this.multiplyScalar( Math.max( min, Math.min( max, length ) ) / length );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.clampScalar ( minVal, maxVal )

  • description and source-code
    function clampScalar( minVal, maxVal ) {

				if ( min === undefined ) {

					min = new Vector3();
					max = new Vector3();

				}

				min.set( minVal, minVal, minVal );
				max.set( maxVal, maxVal, maxVal );

				return this.clamp( min, max );

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.clone ()

  • description and source-code
    clone = function () {

			return new this.constructor( this.x, this.y, this.z );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.constructor ( x, y, z )

  • description and source-code
    function Vector3( x, y, z ) {

		this.x = x || 0;
		this.y = y || 0;
		this.z = z || 0;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.copy ( v )

  • description and source-code
    copy = function ( v ) {

			this.x = v.x;
			this.y = v.y;
			this.z = v.z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.cross ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    cross = function ( v, w ) {

			if ( w !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .cross() now only accepts one argument. Use .crossVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
				return this.crossVectors( v, w );

			}

			var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;

			this.x = y * v.z - z * v.y;
			this.y = z * v.x - x * v.z;
			this.z = x * v.y - y * v.x;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.crossVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    crossVectors = function ( a, b ) {

			var ax = a.x, ay = a.y, az = a.z;
			var bx = b.x, by = b.y, bz = b.z;

			this.x = ay * bz - az * by;
			this.y = az * bx - ax * bz;
			this.z = ax * by - ay * bx;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.distanceTo ( v )

  • description and source-code
    distanceTo = function ( v ) {

			return Math.sqrt( this.distanceToSquared( v ) );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.distanceToManhattan ( v )

  • description and source-code
    distanceToManhattan = function ( v ) {

			return Math.abs( this.x - v.x ) + Math.abs( this.y - v.y ) + Math.abs( this.z - v.z );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.distanceToSquared ( v )

  • description and source-code
    distanceToSquared = function ( v ) {

			var dx = this.x - v.x, dy = this.y - v.y, dz = this.z - v.z;

			return dx * dx + dy * dy + dz * dz;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.divide ( v )

  • description and source-code
    divide = function ( v ) {

			this.x /= v.x;
			this.y /= v.y;
			this.z /= v.z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.divideScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    divideScalar = function ( scalar ) {

			return this.multiplyScalar( 1 / scalar );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.dot ( v )

  • description and source-code
    dot = function ( v ) {

			return this.x * v.x + this.y * v.y + this.z * v.z;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.equals ( v )

  • description and source-code
    equals = function ( v ) {

			return ( ( v.x === this.x ) && ( v.y === this.y ) && ( v.z === this.z ) );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    floor = function () {

			this.x = Math.floor( this.x );
			this.y = Math.floor( this.y );
			this.z = Math.floor( this.z );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.fromArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromArray = function ( array, offset ) {

			if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

			this.x = array[ offset ];
			this.y = array[ offset + 1 ];
			this.z = array[ offset + 2 ];

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.fromAttribute ( attribute, index, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromAttribute = function ( attribute, index, offset ) {

			console.error( 'THREE.Vector3: .fromAttribute() has been renamed to .fromBufferAttribute().' );
			return this.fromBufferAttribute( attribute, index, offset );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.fromBufferAttribute ( attribute, index, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromBufferAttribute = function ( attribute, index, offset ) {

			if ( offset !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: offset has been removed from .fromBufferAttribute().' );

			}

			this.x = attribute.getX( index );
			this.y = attribute.getY( index );
			this.z = attribute.getZ( index );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.getColumnFromMatrix ( index, matrix )

  • description and source-code
    getColumnFromMatrix = function ( index, matrix ) {

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .getColumnFromMatrix() has been renamed to .setFromMatrixColumn().' );
			return this.setFromMatrixColumn( matrix, index );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.getComponent ( index )

  • description and source-code
    getComponent = function ( index ) {

			switch ( index ) {

				case 0: return this.x;
				case 1: return this.y;
				case 2: return this.z;
				default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

			}

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

			console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .getPositionFromMatrix() has been renamed to .setFromMatrixPosition().' );
			return this.setFromMatrixPosition( m );

		}

			return this.setFromMatrixScale( m );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.length ()

  • description and source-code
    length = function () {

			return Math.sqrt( this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y + this.z * this.z );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.lengthManhattan ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthManhattan = function () {

			return Math.abs( this.x ) + Math.abs( this.y ) + Math.abs( this.z );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.lengthSq ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthSq = function () {

			return this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y + this.z * this.z;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.lerp ( v, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerp = function ( v, alpha ) {

			this.x += ( v.x - this.x ) * alpha;
			this.y += ( v.y - this.y ) * alpha;
			this.z += ( v.z - this.z ) * alpha;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.lerpVectors ( v1, v2, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerpVectors = function ( v1, v2, alpha ) {

			return this.subVectors( v2, v1 ).multiplyScalar( alpha ).add( v1 );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.max ( v )

  • description and source-code
    max = function ( v ) {

			this.x = Math.max( this.x, v.x );
			this.y = Math.max( this.y, v.y );
			this.z = Math.max( this.z, v.z );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.min ( v )

  • description and source-code
    min = function ( v ) {

			this.x = Math.min( this.x, v.x );
			this.y = Math.min( this.y, v.y );
			this.z = Math.min( this.z, v.z );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.multiply ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    multiply = function ( v, w ) {

			if ( w !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .multiply() now only accepts one argument. Use .multiplyVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
				return this.multiplyVectors( v, w );

			}

			this.x *= v.x;
			this.y *= v.y;
			this.z *= v.z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.multiplyScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    multiplyScalar = function ( scalar ) {

			if ( isFinite( scalar ) ) {

				this.x *= scalar;
				this.y *= scalar;
				this.z *= scalar;

			} else {

				this.x = 0;
				this.y = 0;
				this.z = 0;

			}

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.multiplyVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    multiplyVectors = function ( a, b ) {

			this.x = a.x * b.x;
			this.y = a.y * b.y;
			this.z = a.z * b.z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.negate ()

  • description and source-code
    negate = function () {

			this.x = - this.x;
			this.y = - this.y;
			this.z = - this.z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.normalize ()

  • description and source-code
    normalize = function () {

			return this.divideScalar( this.length() );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.project ( camera )

  • description and source-code
    function project( camera ) {

				if ( matrix === undefined ) matrix = new Matrix4();

				matrix.multiplyMatrices( camera.projectionMatrix, matrix.getInverse( camera.matrixWorld ) );
				return this.applyMatrix4( matrix );

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.projectOnPlane ( planeNormal )

  • description and source-code
    function projectOnPlane( planeNormal ) {

				if ( v1 === undefined ) v1 = new Vector3();

				v1.copy( this ).projectOnVector( planeNormal );

				return this.sub( v1 );

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.projectOnVector ( vector )

  • description and source-code
    projectOnVector = function ( vector ) {

			var scalar = vector.dot( this ) / vector.lengthSq();

			return this.copy( vector ).multiplyScalar( scalar );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.reflect ( normal )

  • description and source-code
    function reflect( normal ) {

				if ( v1 === undefined ) v1 = new Vector3();

				return this.sub( v1.copy( normal ).multiplyScalar( 2 * this.dot( normal ) ) );

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.round ()

  • description and source-code
    round = function () {

			this.x = Math.round( this.x );
			this.y = Math.round( this.y );
			this.z = Math.round( this.z );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.roundToZero ()

  • description and source-code
    roundToZero = function () {

			this.x = ( this.x < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.x ) : Math.floor( this.x );
			this.y = ( this.y < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.y ) : Math.floor( this.y );
			this.z = ( this.z < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.z ) : Math.floor( this.z );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.set ( x, y, z )

  • description and source-code
    set = function ( x, y, z ) {

			this.x = x;
			this.y = y;
			this.z = z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.setComponent ( index, value )

  • description and source-code
    setComponent = function ( index, value ) {

			switch ( index ) {

				case 0: this.x = value; break;
				case 1: this.y = value; break;
				case 2: this.z = value; break;
				default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

			}

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

    setEulerFromQuaternion = function () {

			console.error( 'THREE.Vector3: .setEulerFromQuaternion() has been removed. Use Euler.setFromQuaternion() instead.' );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    setEulerFromRotationMatrix = function () {

			console.error( 'THREE.Vector3: .setEulerFromRotationMatrix() has been removed. Use Euler.setFromRotationMatrix() instead.' );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.setFromCylindrical ( c )

  • description and source-code
    setFromCylindrical = function ( c ) {

			this.x = c.radius * Math.sin( c.theta );
			this.y = c.y;
			this.z = c.radius * Math.cos( c.theta );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.setFromMatrixColumn ( m, index )

  • description and source-code
    setFromMatrixColumn = function ( m, index ) {

			if ( typeof m === 'number' ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: setFromMatrixColumn now expects ( matrix, index ).' );
				var temp = m;
				m = index;
				index = temp;

			}

			return this.fromArray( m.elements, index * 4 );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.setFromMatrixPosition ( m )

  • description and source-code
    setFromMatrixPosition = function ( m ) {

			return this.setFromMatrixColumn( m, 3 );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.setFromMatrixScale ( m )

  • description and source-code
    setFromMatrixScale = function ( m ) {

			var sx = this.setFromMatrixColumn( m, 0 ).length();
			var sy = this.setFromMatrixColumn( m, 1 ).length();
			var sz = this.setFromMatrixColumn( m, 2 ).length();

			this.x = sx;
			this.y = sy;
			this.z = sz;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.setFromSpherical ( s )

  • description and source-code
    setFromSpherical = function ( s ) {

			var sinPhiRadius = Math.sin( s.phi ) * s.radius;

			this.x = sinPhiRadius * Math.sin( s.theta );
			this.y = Math.cos( s.phi ) * s.radius;
			this.z = sinPhiRadius * Math.cos( s.theta );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.setLength ( length )

  • description and source-code
    setLength = function ( length ) {

			return this.multiplyScalar( length / this.length() );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    setScalar = function ( scalar ) {

			this.x = scalar;
			this.y = scalar;
			this.z = scalar;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

			return this;

			return this;

		}

function three.Vector3.prototype.sub ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    sub = function ( v, w ) {

			if ( w !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector3: .sub() now only accepts one argument. Use .subVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
				return this.subVectors( v, w );

			}

			this.x -= v.x;
			this.y -= v.y;
			this.z -= v.z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.subScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    subScalar = function ( s ) {

			this.x -= s;
			this.y -= s;
			this.z -= s;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.subVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    subVectors = function ( a, b ) {

			this.x = a.x - b.x;
			this.y = a.y - b.y;
			this.z = a.z - b.z;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.toArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    toArray = function ( array, offset ) {

			if ( array === undefined ) array = [];
			if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

			array[ offset ] = this.x;
			array[ offset + 1 ] = this.y;
			array[ offset + 2 ] = this.z;

			return array;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.transformDirection ( m )

  • description and source-code
    transformDirection = function ( m ) {

			// input: THREE.Matrix4 affine matrix
			// vector interpreted as a direction

			var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z;
			var e = m.elements;

			this.x = e[ 0 ] * x + e[ 4 ] * y + e[ 8 ]  * z;
			this.y = e[ 1 ] * x + e[ 5 ] * y + e[ 9 ]  * z;
			this.z = e[ 2 ] * x + e[ 6 ] * y + e[ 10 ] * z;

			return this.normalize();

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector3.prototype.unproject ( camera )

  • description and source-code
    function unproject( camera ) {

				if ( matrix === undefined ) matrix = new Matrix4();

				matrix.multiplyMatrices( camera.matrixWorld, matrix.getInverse( camera.projectionMatrix ) );
				return this.applyMatrix4( matrix );

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.Vector4

function three.Vector4 ( x, y, z, w )

  • description and source-code
    function Vector4( x, y, z, w ) {

		this.x = x || 0;
		this.y = y || 0;
		this.z = z || 0;
		this.w = ( w !== undefined ) ? w : 1;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.Vector4.prototype

function three.Vector4.prototype.add ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    add = function ( v, w ) {

			if ( w !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector4: .add() now only accepts one argument. Use .addVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
				return this.addVectors( v, w );

			}

			this.x += v.x;
			this.y += v.y;
			this.z += v.z;
			this.w += v.w;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    ...
	camera = new THREE.PerspectiveCamera( 75, window.innerWidth / window.innerHeight, 1, 10000 );
	camera.position.z = 1000;

	geometry = new THREE.BoxGeometry( 200, 200, 200 );
	material = new THREE.MeshBasicMaterial( { color: 0xff0000, wireframe: true } );

	mesh = new THREE.Mesh( geometry, material );
	scene.add( mesh );

	renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer();
	renderer.setSize( window.innerWidth, window.innerHeight );

	document.body.appendChild( renderer.domElement );

}
...

function three.Vector4.prototype.addScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    addScalar = function ( s ) {

			this.x += s;
			this.y += s;
			this.z += s;
			this.w += s;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.addScaledVector ( v, s )

  • description and source-code
    addScaledVector = function ( v, s ) {

			this.x += v.x * s;
			this.y += v.y * s;
			this.z += v.z * s;
			this.w += v.w * s;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.addVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    addVectors = function ( a, b ) {

			this.x = a.x + b.x;
			this.y = a.y + b.y;
			this.z = a.z + b.z;
			this.w = a.w + b.w;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.applyMatrix4 ( m )

  • description and source-code
    applyMatrix4 = function ( m ) {

			var x = this.x, y = this.y, z = this.z, w = this.w;
			var e = m.elements;

			this.x = e[ 0 ] * x + e[ 4 ] * y + e[ 8 ] * z + e[ 12 ] * w;
			this.y = e[ 1 ] * x + e[ 5 ] * y + e[ 9 ] * z + e[ 13 ] * w;
			this.z = e[ 2 ] * x + e[ 6 ] * y + e[ 10 ] * z + e[ 14 ] * w;
			this.w = e[ 3 ] * x + e[ 7 ] * y + e[ 11 ] * z + e[ 15 ] * w;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.ceil ()

  • description and source-code
    ceil = function () {

			this.x = Math.ceil( this.x );
			this.y = Math.ceil( this.y );
			this.z = Math.ceil( this.z );
			this.w = Math.ceil( this.w );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.clamp ( min, max )

  • description and source-code
    clamp = function ( min, max ) {

			// This function assumes min < max, if this assumption isn't true it will not operate correctly

			this.x = Math.max( min.x, Math.min( max.x, this.x ) );
			this.y = Math.max( min.y, Math.min( max.y, this.y ) );
			this.z = Math.max( min.z, Math.min( max.z, this.z ) );
			this.w = Math.max( min.w, Math.min( max.w, this.w ) );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.clampScalar ( minVal, maxVal )

  • description and source-code
    function clampScalar( minVal, maxVal ) {

				if ( min === undefined ) {

					min = new Vector4();
					max = new Vector4();

				}

				min.set( minVal, minVal, minVal, minVal );
				max.set( maxVal, maxVal, maxVal, maxVal );

				return this.clamp( min, max );

			}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.clone ()

  • description and source-code
    clone = function () {

			return new this.constructor( this.x, this.y, this.z, this.w );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.constructor ( x, y, z, w )

  • description and source-code
    function Vector4( x, y, z, w ) {

		this.x = x || 0;
		this.y = y || 0;
		this.z = z || 0;
		this.w = ( w !== undefined ) ? w : 1;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.copy ( v )

  • description and source-code
    copy = function ( v ) {

			this.x = v.x;
			this.y = v.y;
			this.z = v.z;
			this.w = ( v.w !== undefined ) ? v.w : 1;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.divideScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    divideScalar = function ( scalar ) {

			return this.multiplyScalar( 1 / scalar );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.dot ( v )

  • description and source-code
    dot = function ( v ) {

			return this.x * v.x + this.y * v.y + this.z * v.z + this.w * v.w;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.equals ( v )

  • description and source-code
    equals = function ( v ) {

			return ( ( v.x === this.x ) && ( v.y === this.y ) && ( v.z === this.z ) && ( v.w === this.w ) );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    floor = function () {

			this.x = Math.floor( this.x );
			this.y = Math.floor( this.y );
			this.z = Math.floor( this.z );
			this.w = Math.floor( this.w );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.fromArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromArray = function ( array, offset ) {

			if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

			this.x = array[ offset ];
			this.y = array[ offset + 1 ];
			this.z = array[ offset + 2 ];
			this.w = array[ offset + 3 ];

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.fromAttribute ( attribute, index, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromAttribute = function ( attribute, index, offset ) {

			console.error( 'THREE.Vector4: .fromAttribute() has been renamed to .fromBufferAttribute().' );
			return this.fromBufferAttribute( attribute, index, offset );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.fromBufferAttribute ( attribute, index, offset )

  • description and source-code
    fromBufferAttribute = function ( attribute, index, offset ) {

			if ( offset !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector4: offset has been removed from .fromBufferAttribute().' );

			}

			this.x = attribute.getX( index );
			this.y = attribute.getY( index );
			this.z = attribute.getZ( index );
			this.w = attribute.getW( index );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.getComponent ( index )

  • description and source-code
    getComponent = function ( index ) {

			switch ( index ) {

				case 0: return this.x;
				case 1: return this.y;
				case 2: return this.z;
				case 3: return this.w;
				default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

			}

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.length ()

  • description and source-code
    length = function () {

			return Math.sqrt( this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y + this.z * this.z + this.w * this.w );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.lengthManhattan ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthManhattan = function () {

			return Math.abs( this.x ) + Math.abs( this.y ) + Math.abs( this.z ) + Math.abs( this.w );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.lengthSq ()

  • description and source-code
    lengthSq = function () {

			return this.x * this.x + this.y * this.y + this.z * this.z + this.w * this.w;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.lerp ( v, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerp = function ( v, alpha ) {

			this.x += ( v.x - this.x ) * alpha;
			this.y += ( v.y - this.y ) * alpha;
			this.z += ( v.z - this.z ) * alpha;
			this.w += ( v.w - this.w ) * alpha;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.lerpVectors ( v1, v2, alpha )

  • description and source-code
    lerpVectors = function ( v1, v2, alpha ) {

			return this.subVectors( v2, v1 ).multiplyScalar( alpha ).add( v1 );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

			this.x = Math.max( this.x, v.x );
			this.y = Math.max( this.y, v.y );
			this.z = Math.max( this.z, v.z );
			this.w = Math.max( this.w, v.w );

			return this;

		}

			this.x = Math.min( this.x, v.x );
			this.y = Math.min( this.y, v.y );
			this.z = Math.min( this.z, v.z );
			this.w = Math.min( this.w, v.w );

			return this;

function three.Vector4.prototype.multiplyScalar ( scalar )

  • description and source-code
    multiplyScalar = function ( scalar ) {

			if ( isFinite( scalar ) ) {

				this.x *= scalar;
				this.y *= scalar;
				this.z *= scalar;
				this.w *= scalar;

			} else {

				this.x = 0;
				this.y = 0;
				this.z = 0;
				this.w = 0;

			}

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.negate ()

  • description and source-code
    negate = function () {

			this.x = - this.x;
			this.y = - this.y;
			this.z = - this.z;
			this.w = - this.w;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.normalize ()

  • description and source-code
    normalize = function () {

			return this.divideScalar( this.length() );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.round ()

  • description and source-code
    round = function () {

			this.x = Math.round( this.x );
			this.y = Math.round( this.y );
			this.z = Math.round( this.z );
			this.w = Math.round( this.w );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.roundToZero ()

  • description and source-code
    roundToZero = function () {

			this.x = ( this.x < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.x ) : Math.floor( this.x );
			this.y = ( this.y < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.y ) : Math.floor( this.y );
			this.z = ( this.z < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.z ) : Math.floor( this.z );
			this.w = ( this.w < 0 ) ? Math.ceil( this.w ) : Math.floor( this.w );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.set ( x, y, z, w )

  • description and source-code
    set = function ( x, y, z, w ) {

			this.x = x;
			this.y = y;
			this.z = z;
			this.w = w;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.setAxisAngleFromQuaternion ( q )

  • description and source-code
    setAxisAngleFromQuaternion = function ( q ) {

			// http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/geometry/rotations/conversions/quaternionToAngle/index.htm

			// q is assumed to be normalized

			this.w = 2 * Math.acos( q.w );

			var s = Math.sqrt( 1 - q.w * q.w );

			if ( s < 0.0001 ) {

				 this.x = 1;
				 this.y = 0;
				 this.z = 0;

			} else {

				 this.x = q.x / s;
				 this.y = q.y / s;
				 this.z = q.z / s;

			}

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.setAxisAngleFromRotationMatrix ( m )

  • description and source-code
    setAxisAngleFromRotationMatrix = function ( m ) {

			// http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/geometry/rotations/conversions/matrixToAngle/index.htm

			// assumes the upper 3x3 of m is a pure rotation matrix (i.e, unscaled)

			var angle, x, y, z,		// variables for result
				epsilon = 0.01,		// margin to allow for rounding errors
				epsilon2 = 0.1,		// margin to distinguish between 0 and 180 degrees

				te = m.elements,

				m11 = te[ 0 ], m12 = te[ 4 ], m13 = te[ 8 ],
				m21 = te[ 1 ], m22 = te[ 5 ], m23 = te[ 9 ],
				m31 = te[ 2 ], m32 = te[ 6 ], m33 = te[ 10 ];

			if ( ( Math.abs( m12 - m21 ) < epsilon ) &&
			     ( Math.abs( m13 - m31 ) < epsilon ) &&
			     ( Math.abs( m23 - m32 ) < epsilon ) ) {

				// singularity found
				// first check for identity matrix which must have +1 for all terms
				// in leading diagonal and zero in other terms

				if ( ( Math.abs( m12 + m21 ) < epsilon2 ) &&
				     ( Math.abs( m13 + m31 ) < epsilon2 ) &&
				     ( Math.abs( m23 + m32 ) < epsilon2 ) &&
				     ( Math.abs( m11 + m22 + m33 - 3 ) < epsilon2 ) ) {

					// this singularity is identity matrix so angle = 0

					this.set( 1, 0, 0, 0 );

					return this; // zero angle, arbitrary axis

				}

				// otherwise this singularity is angle = 180

				angle = Math.PI;

				var xx = ( m11 + 1 ) / 2;
				var yy = ( m22 + 1 ) / 2;
				var zz = ( m33 + 1 ) / 2;
				var xy = ( m12 + m21 ) / 4;
				var xz = ( m13 + m31 ) / 4;
				var yz = ( m23 + m32 ) / 4;

				if ( ( xx > yy ) && ( xx > zz ) ) {

					// m11 is the largest diagonal term

					if ( xx < epsilon ) {

						x = 0;
						y = 0.707106781;
						z = 0.707106781;

					} else {

						x = Math.sqrt( xx );
						y = xy / x;
						z = xz / x;

					}

				} else if ( yy > zz ) {

					// m22 is the largest diagonal term

					if ( yy < epsilon ) {

						x = 0.707106781;
						y = 0;
						z = 0.707106781;

					} else {

						y = Math.sqrt( yy );
						x = xy / y;
						z = yz / y;

					}

				} else {

					// m33 is the largest diagonal term so base result on this

					if ( zz < epsilon ) {

						x = 0.707106781;
						y = 0.707106781;
						z = 0;

					} else {

						z = Math.sqrt( zz );
						x = xz / z;
						y = yz / z;

					}

				}

				this.set( x, y, z, angle );

				return this; // return 180 deg rotation

			}

			// as we have reached here there are no singularities so we can handle normally

			var s = Math.sqrt( ( m32 - m23 ) * ( m32 - m23 ) +
			                   ( m13 - m31 ) * ( m13 - m31 ) +
			                   ( m21 - m12 ) * ( m21 - m12 ) ); // used to normalize

			if ( Math.abs( s ) < 0.001 ) s = 1;

			// prevent divide by zero, should not happen if matrix is orthogonal and should be
			// caught by singularity test above, but I've left it in just in case

			this.x = ( m32 - m23 ) / s;
			this.y = ( m13 - m31 ) / s;
			this.z = ( m21 - m12 ) / s;
			this.w = Math.acos( ( m11 + m22 + m33 - 1 ) / 2 );

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.setComponent ( index, value )

  • description and source-code
    setComponent = function ( index, value ) {

			switch ( index ) {

				case 0: this.x = value; break;
				case 1: this.y = value; break;
				case 2: this.z = value; break;
				case 3: this.w = value; break;
				default: throw new Error( 'index is out of range: ' + index );

			}

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    setLength = function ( length ) {

			return this.multiplyScalar( length / this.length() );

		}
  • example usage

function three.Vector4.prototype.sub ( v, w )

  • description and source-code
    sub = function ( v, w ) {

			if ( w !== undefined ) {

				console.warn( 'THREE.Vector4: .sub() now only accepts one argument. Use .subVectors( a, b ) instead.' );
				return this.subVectors( v, w );

			}

			this.x -= v.x;
			this.y -= v.y;
			this.z -= v.z;
			this.w -= v.w;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.subScalar ( s )

  • description and source-code
    subScalar = function ( s ) {

			this.x -= s;
			this.y -= s;
			this.z -= s;
			this.w -= s;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.subVectors ( a, b )

  • description and source-code
    subVectors = function ( a, b ) {

			this.x = a.x - b.x;
			this.y = a.y - b.y;
			this.z = a.z - b.z;
			this.w = a.w - b.w;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.Vector4.prototype.toArray ( array, offset )

  • description and source-code
    toArray = function ( array, offset ) {

			if ( array === undefined ) array = [];
			if ( offset === undefined ) offset = 0;

			array[ offset ] = this.x;
			array[ offset + 1 ] = this.y;
			array[ offset + 2 ] = this.z;
			array[ offset + 3 ] = this.w;

			return array;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.VertexNormalsHelper

function three.VertexNormalsHelper ( object, size, hex, linewidth )

  • description and source-code
    function VertexNormalsHelper( object, size, hex, linewidth ) {

		this.object = object;

		this.size = ( size !== undefined ) ? size : 1;

		var color = ( hex !== undefined ) ? hex : 0xff0000;

		var width = ( linewidth !== undefined ) ? linewidth : 1;

		//

		var nNormals = 0;

		var objGeometry = this.object.geometry;

		if ( objGeometry && objGeometry.isGeometry ) {

			nNormals = objGeometry.faces.length * 3;

		} else if ( objGeometry && objGeometry.isBufferGeometry ) {

			nNormals = objGeometry.attributes.normal.count;

		}

		//

		var geometry = new BufferGeometry();

		var positions = new Float32BufferAttribute( nNormals * 2 * 3, 3 );

		geometry.addAttribute( 'position', positions );

		LineSegments.call( this, geometry, new LineBasicMaterial( { color: color, linewidth: width } ) );

		//

		this.matrixAutoUpdate = false;

		this.update();

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.VertexNormalsHelper.prototype

function three.VertexNormalsHelper.prototype.constructor ( object, size, hex, linewidth )

  • description and source-code
    function VertexNormalsHelper( object, size, hex, linewidth ) {

		this.object = object;

		this.size = ( size !== undefined ) ? size : 1;

		var color = ( hex !== undefined ) ? hex : 0xff0000;

		var width = ( linewidth !== undefined ) ? linewidth : 1;

		//

		var nNormals = 0;

		var objGeometry = this.object.geometry;

		if ( objGeometry && objGeometry.isGeometry ) {

			nNormals = objGeometry.faces.length * 3;

		} else if ( objGeometry && objGeometry.isBufferGeometry ) {

			nNormals = objGeometry.attributes.normal.count;

		}

		//

		var geometry = new BufferGeometry();

		var positions = new Float32BufferAttribute( nNormals * 2 * 3, 3 );

		geometry.addAttribute( 'position', positions );

		LineSegments.call( this, geometry, new LineBasicMaterial( { color: color, linewidth: width } ) );

		//

		this.matrixAutoUpdate = false;

		this.update();

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.VertexNormalsHelper.prototype.update ()

  • description and source-code
    function update() {

			var keys = [ 'a', 'b', 'c' ];

			this.object.updateMatrixWorld( true );

			normalMatrix.getNormalMatrix( this.object.matrixWorld );

			var matrixWorld = this.object.matrixWorld;

			var position = this.geometry.attributes.position;

			//

			var objGeometry = this.object.geometry;

			if ( objGeometry && objGeometry.isGeometry ) {

				var vertices = objGeometry.vertices;

				var faces = objGeometry.faces;

				var idx = 0;

				for ( var i = 0, l = faces.length; i < l; i ++ ) {

					var face = faces[ i ];

					for ( var j = 0, jl = face.vertexNormals.length; j < jl; j ++ ) {

						var vertex = vertices[ face[ keys[ j ] ] ];

						var normal = face.vertexNormals[ j ];

						v1.copy( vertex ).applyMatrix4( matrixWorld );

						v2.copy( normal ).applyMatrix3( normalMatrix ).normalize().multiplyScalar( this.size ).add( v1 );

						position.setXYZ( idx, v1.x, v1.y, v1.z );

						idx = idx + 1;

						position.setXYZ( idx, v2.x, v2.y, v2.z );

						idx = idx + 1;

					}

				}

			} else if ( objGeometry && objGeometry.isBufferGeometry ) {

				var objPos = objGeometry.attributes.position;

				var objNorm = objGeometry.attributes.normal;

				var idx = 0;

				// for simplicity, ignore index and drawcalls, and render every normal

				for ( var j = 0, jl = objPos.count; j < jl; j ++ ) {

					v1.set( objPos.getX( j ), objPos.getY( j ), objPos.getZ( j ) ).applyMatrix4( matrixWorld );

					v2.set( objNorm.getX( j ), objNorm.getY( j ), objNorm.getZ( j ) );

					v2.applyMatrix3( normalMatrix ).normalize().multiplyScalar( this.size ).add( v1 );

					position.setXYZ( idx, v1.x, v1.y, v1.z );

					idx = idx + 1;

					position.setXYZ( idx, v2.x, v2.y, v2.z );

					idx = idx + 1;

				}

			}

			position.needsUpdate = true;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.VideoTexture

function three.VideoTexture ( video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy )

  • description and source-code
    function VideoTexture( video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy ) {

		Texture.call( this, video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy );

		this.generateMipmaps = false;

		var scope = this;

		function update() {

			requestAnimationFrame( update );

			if ( video.readyState >= video.HAVE_CURRENT_DATA ) {

				scope.needsUpdate = true;

			}

		}

		update();

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.VideoTexture.prototype

function three.VideoTexture.prototype.constructor ( video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy )

  • description and source-code
    function VideoTexture( video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy ) {

		Texture.call( this, video, mapping, wrapS, wrapT, magFilter, minFilter, format, type, anisotropy );

		this.generateMipmaps = false;

		var scope = this;

		function update() {

			requestAnimationFrame( update );

			if ( video.readyState >= video.HAVE_CURRENT_DATA ) {

				scope.needsUpdate = true;

			}

		}

		update();

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.WebGLRenderTarget

function three.WebGLRenderTarget ( width, height, options )

  • description and source-code
    function WebGLRenderTarget( width, height, options ) {

		this.uuid = _Math.generateUUID();

		this.width = width;
		this.height = height;

		this.scissor = new Vector4( 0, 0, width, height );
		this.scissorTest = false;

		this.viewport = new Vector4( 0, 0, width, height );

		options = options || {};

		if ( options.minFilter === undefined ) options.minFilter = LinearFilter;

		this.texture = new Texture( undefined, undefined, options.wrapS, options.wrapT, options.magFilter, options.minFilter, options.
format, options.type, options.anisotropy, options.encoding );

		this.depthBuffer = options.depthBuffer !== undefined ? options.depthBuffer : true;
		this.stencilBuffer = options.stencilBuffer !== undefined ? options.stencilBuffer : true;
		this.depthTexture = options.depthTexture !== undefined ? options.depthTexture : null;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

module three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype

function three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.addEventListener ( type, listener )

  • description and source-code
    addEventListener = function ( type, listener ) {

			if ( this._listeners === undefined ) this._listeners = {};

			var listeners = this._listeners;

			if ( listeners[ type ] === undefined ) {

				listeners[ type ] = [];

			}

			if ( listeners[ type ].indexOf( listener ) === - 1 ) {

				listeners[ type ].push( listener );

			}

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.clone ()

  • description and source-code
    clone = function () {

			return new this.constructor().copy( this );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.constructor ( width, height, options )

  • description and source-code
    function WebGLRenderTarget( width, height, options ) {

		this.uuid = _Math.generateUUID();

		this.width = width;
		this.height = height;

		this.scissor = new Vector4( 0, 0, width, height );
		this.scissorTest = false;

		this.viewport = new Vector4( 0, 0, width, height );

		options = options || {};

		if ( options.minFilter === undefined ) options.minFilter = LinearFilter;

		this.texture = new Texture( undefined, undefined, options.wrapS, options.wrapT, options.magFilter, options.minFilter, options.
format, options.type, options.anisotropy, options.encoding );

		this.depthBuffer = options.depthBuffer !== undefined ? options.depthBuffer : true;
		this.stencilBuffer = options.stencilBuffer !== undefined ? options.stencilBuffer : true;
		this.depthTexture = options.depthTexture !== undefined ? options.depthTexture : null;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.copy ( source )

  • description and source-code
    copy = function ( source ) {

			this.width = source.width;
			this.height = source.height;

			this.viewport.copy( source.viewport );

			this.texture = source.texture.clone();

			this.depthBuffer = source.depthBuffer;
			this.stencilBuffer = source.stencilBuffer;
			this.depthTexture = source.depthTexture;

			return this;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.dispatchEvent ( event )

  • description and source-code
    dispatchEvent = function ( event ) {

			if ( this._listeners === undefined ) return;

			var listeners = this._listeners;
			var listenerArray = listeners[ event.type ];

			if ( listenerArray !== undefined ) {

				event.target = this;

				var array = [], i = 0;
				var length = listenerArray.length;

				for ( i = 0; i < length; i ++ ) {

					array[ i ] = listenerArray[ i ];

				}

				for ( i = 0; i < length; i ++ ) {

					array[ i ].call( this, event );

				}

			}

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.dispose ()

  • description and source-code
    dispose = function () {

			this.dispatchEvent( { type: 'dispose' } );

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.hasEventListener ( type, listener )

  • description and source-code
    hasEventListener = function ( type, listener ) {

			if ( this._listeners === undefined ) return false;

			var listeners = this._listeners;

			return listeners[ type ] !== undefined && listeners[ type ].indexOf( listener ) !== - 1;

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.removeEventListener ( type, listener )

  • description and source-code
    removeEventListener = function ( type, listener ) {

			if ( this._listeners === undefined ) return;

			var listeners = this._listeners;
			var listenerArray = listeners[ type ];

			if ( listenerArray !== undefined ) {

				var index = listenerArray.indexOf( listener );

				if ( index !== - 1 ) {

					listenerArray.splice( index, 1 );

				}

			}

		}
  • example usage
    n/a

function three.WebGLRenderTarget.prototype.setSize ( width, height )

  • description and source-code
    setSize = function ( width, height ) {

			if ( this.width !== width || this.height !== height ) {

				this.width = width;
				this.height = height;

				this.dispose();

			}

			this.viewport.set( 0, 0, width, height );
			this.scissor.set( 0, 0, width, height );

		}
  • example usage
    ...
	geometry = new THREE.BoxGeometry( 200, 200, 200 );
	material = new THREE.MeshBasicMaterial( { color: 0xff0000, wireframe: true } );

	mesh = new THREE.Mesh( geometry, material );
	scene.add( mesh );

	renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer();
	renderer.setSize( window.innerWidth, window.innerHeight );

	document.body.appendChild( renderer.domElement );

}

module three.WebGLRenderTargetCube

function three.WebGLRenderTargetCube ( width, height, options )

  • description and source-code
    function WebGLRenderTargetCube( width, height, options ) {

		WebGLRenderTarget.call( this, width, height, options );

		this.activeCubeFace = 0; // PX 0, NX 1, PY 2, NY 3, PZ 4, NZ 5
		this.activeMipMapLevel = 0;

	}
  • example usage
    n/a

		this.activeCubeFace = 0; // PX 0, NX 1, PY 2, NY 3, PZ 4, NZ 5
		this.activeMipMapLevel = 0;

	}
  • example usage
